page.title: 10THE VILLAGE - Main Street
page.content: sharp left and seawards, in a street called The Wynd, stand the walls of what are known as The Maltings, this being a large warehouse for the storage of grain which was exported from Kilspindie in the old days, from farms in this richly fertile area. The hoist used for lifting the grain sacks can still be seen. Almost opposite The Maltings is the village community hall. It is still in fairly regular use - various local organisations e.g. badminton club, youth club etc meet there - but the hall itself is in a fairly delapidated state even though a great deal of community effort is utilised to maintain it. A number of old houses surround the sea green which causes the road to take a sharp turn to the right before heading on its way to Gullane.
